image.altText: A wide shot of the front entrance an to Casuarina Prison with a sign and car park on the right.

items.synopsis: A young boy who is fighting for life in hospital after attempting to take his own life in Casuarina Prison's notorious Unit 18 had been told just hours earlier his bail application had been adjourned for at least the third time.

title.children: Teen remains on life-support after self-harming in cell, as court transcript sheds light on situation

image.altText: Joe Biden hugs Benjamin Netanyahu as the press take photos on the tarmac of an airport

items.synopsis: Israel's defence force denies responsibility for the deadly explosion at al-Ahli Arab hospital as US President Joe Biden arrives in Tel Aviv. Follow live.

title.children: IDF says aerial footage shows no direct hit to Gaza hospital as Biden lands in Israel

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: US President Joe Biden said on Wednesday that Washington would provide Israel with everything it needed to defend itself as it wages war against the Palestinian militant group Hamas. Biden, who landed in Israel and met Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu early on Wednesday, said Hamas was worse than Islamic State for its killings of Israeli civilians in a surprise attack on October 7 which sparked the latest Israel-Palestinian violence. Biden said he was "saddened and outraged" by an explosion at a hospital in the Gaza Strip on Tuesday which Hamas said killed hundreds of people, but added that it seemed the "other team" was responsible, in reference to Palestinian militants. Biden said 31 Americans were among the more than 1,300 Israelis killed in Hamas's October 7 attack. Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Biden begins talks with Netanyahu, says it will provide Israel with everything it needs to defend itself

children.content: US President Joe Biden
said on Wednesday that Washington would provide Israel with everything it needed to defend itself as it wages war against the Palestinian militant group Hamas.
Biden, who landed in Israel and met
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu
early on Wednesday, said Hamas was worse than Islamic State for its killings of Israeli civilians in a surprise attack on October 7 which sparked the latest Israel-Palestinian violence.

Biden said he was "saddened and outraged" by an explosion at a hospital in the Gaza Strip on Tuesday which Hamas said killed hundreds of people, but added that it seemed the "other team" was responsible, in reference to Palestinian militants.
Biden said 31 Americans were among the more than 1,300 Israelis killed in Hamas's October 7 attack.

props.alt: Biden and Netanyahu meet, both are sitting down.

children.content: (AP: Evan Vucci)
Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: US President Joe Biden has just landed in Israel's Tel Aviv for urgent meetings. Descending from the plane amid a large security contingent, Biden embraced Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Isaac Herzog on the tarmac. They spoke briefly before departing in a convoy. ABC/Reuters
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: US President Joe Biden lands in Israel

children.content: US President Joe Biden has just landed in Israel's Tel Aviv for urgent meetings.
Descending from the plane amid a large security contingent, Biden embraced Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and President Isaac Herzog on the tarmac.
They spoke briefly before departing in a convoy.

props.alt: Biden and Netanyahu hug on the tarmac.

children.content: (AP: Evan Vucci)
ABC/Reuters

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Israel's defence force has made a statement denying responsibility for the explosion at al-Ahli hospital that has killed hundreds of displaced Gazans. Hamas has claimed it was caused by an Israeli air strike and Israel blamed a rocket that was misfired by the Islamic Jihad militant group. Israel also said there was "no direct hit to the hospital itself". Spokesman Daniel Hagari said the IDF had investigated the blast. "The IDF … has confirmed that the Islamic Jihad was responsible for the strike," he told reporters. "At 6:15pm a barrage of rockets was fired by Hamas to Israel. Then, at 6:59pm a barrage of around 10 rockets was fired by Islamic Jihad from a nearby cemetery. It was at the time, 6:59pm, when there were reports of an explosion at al-Ahli al-Mamdani hospital in Gaza City. "Analysis of our aerial footage confirms there was no direct hit to the hospital itself. The only location damage is outside the hospital in the parking lot where we can see signs of burning … no cratering, and no structural damage to nearby buildings." Rear Admiral Hagari played a recording of what was described as "communication between terrorists talking about rockets misfiring" that, he said, "made specific reference" to the hospital. The IDF claims have not been independently verified. Earlier, US President Joe Biden said he had directed his national security team to gather information about the cause of the blast. Hagari said "trajectory analysis" showed rockets being fired close to the hospital, and that Israel's investigation was based on "intelligence, operational systems and aerial footage, all of which we cross checked". Asked how an Islamic Jihad rocket could cause so much death and destruction, the IDF blamed the rocket's fuel. "Due to the rocket flight it was very, very short because the launch has failed," Rear Admiral Hagari said. "The existence of propellant made a larger explosion than the warhead itself."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Israel says aerial footage shows 'no direct hit' to hospital

children.content: Israel's defence force has made a statement denying responsibility for the explosion at al-Ahli hospital that has killed hundreds of displaced Gazans.
Hamas has claimed it was caused by an Israeli air strike and Israel blamed a rocket that was misfired by the Islamic Jihad militant group.
Israel also said there was "no direct hit to the hospital itself".
Spokesman Daniel Hagari said the IDF had investigated the blast.
"The IDF … has confirmed that the Islamic Jihad was responsible for the strike," he told reporters.

"At 6:15pm a barrage of rockets was fired by Hamas to Israel. Then, at 6:59pm a barrage of around 10 rockets was fired by Islamic Jihad from a nearby cemetery. It was at the time, 6:59pm, when there were reports of an explosion at al-Ahli al-Mamdani hospital in Gaza City.

"Analysis of our aerial footage confirms there was no direct hit to the hospital itself. The only location damage is outside the hospital in the parking lot where we can see signs of burning … no cratering, and no structural damage to nearby buildings."

Rear Admiral Hagari played a recording of what was described as "communication between terrorists talking about rockets misfiring" that, he said, "made specific reference" to the hospital. The IDF claims have not been independently verified.
Earlier, US President Joe Biden said he had directed his national security team to gather information about the cause of the blast.

props.alt: An Israeli soldier speaks to the media.

children.content: IDF spokesman Daniel Hagari addresses the media.
(YouTube)

Hagari said "trajectory analysis" showed rockets being fired close to the hospital, and that Israel's investigation was based on "intelligence, operational systems and aerial footage, all of which we cross checked".
Asked how an Islamic Jihad rocket could cause so much death and destruction, the IDF blamed the rocket's fuel.
"Due to the rocket flight it was very, very short because the launch has failed," Rear Admiral Hagari said.
"The existence of propellant made a larger explosion than the warhead itself."
